conclusion: The problem involves four objects casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D on a green floor, illuminated by a light source.
The question asks how A, B, C, and D will change in position and size when the light source moves downward.

Shadows are cast when an object blocks light, and their position and size depend on the position of the light source and the object.
The shadow is on the side opposite to the light source relative to the object.
The size of the shadow depends on the distance between the object and the light source.
The closer the light source is to the object, the larger the shadow, and vice versa.

premise: If the light source moves downward, the angle between the light rays and the horizontal line decreases.
conclusion: Shadows will move farther from directly beneath the objects.

premise: If the light source moves downward, the light rays illuminate the objects at a lower angle.

conclusion: A, B, C, and D move to the front left and become longer.
